relevant_communication:
SOLWA develops technological solutions in line with the EU policies to protect the environment, to use when possible renewable energies and to reuse waste as raw materials. 
The projects carried out are pilots to improve SOLWA Technological systems: 
1. SolWa, the innovative solar module to treat polluted and seawater has been awarded by the United Nations as "Innovation for Human Development". SolWa modules have been installed in two villages of Burkina Faso, where they are currently running. 
2. IrriWa, the innovative integrated system for agriculture in barren areas had been tested within a National Project of the Italian Government and presented in an Horizon2020 Project. 
3. FoodWa, the innovative solar module to dry food was awarded as "Innovative Idea & Technology for the Agrobusiness Sector" by UNIDO  
4. DryWa, the innovative module to dry sewage sludge from waste water treatment plant and reuse it as raw material and source for energy  will be presented at the Singapore International Water Week 2016.

goals__remit:
SOLWA is an Innovative Company, part of the GreenTech Division of SANTEX RIMAR GROUP, that provides eco-friendly machinery for water treatment, food dehydration, agribusiness sector and waste management. 
 
SOLWA Technology is the hearth of  green innovative solutions in different fields, born as specific process powered only by solar radiation for water evaporation. After a period of R&D in thermofluid dynamic, SOLWA Technology has been employed in different fields: for drying sludge and muds; for drying food; for drying digestate and leachate; to create autonomous system for agriculture in greenhouses; to treat seawater. 
 
The United Nations (IDEASS Program) awarded SolWa as one of the “Innovation for Human Development”.
